examples.name: Navigate to Flex Layout Page
examples.description: Navigate to the flex layout example page

examples.name: Show Info Notification

actions.title: Information
actions.message: This is an info notification from the WebSocket server

examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"notify-info","actions":[{"type":"notify","title":"Information","message":"This is an info notification","severity":"info"}]}'

examples.name: Show Success Notification
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"notify-success","actions":[{"type":"notify","title":"Success!","message":"Operation completed successfully","severity":"success"}]}'

examples.name: Show Warning Notification
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"notify-warning","actions":[{"type":"notify","title":"Warning","message":"CPU usage is above 80%","severity":"warning","duration":5000}]}'

examples.name: Show Error Notification
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"notify-error","actions":[{"type":"notify","title":"Error","message":"Failed to connect to database","severity":"error","duration":5000}]}'

examples.name: Pause Auto-Transitions
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"pause-transitions","actions":[{"type":"transition.pause"},{"type":"notify","title":"Transitions Paused","message":"Auto-transitions paused","severity":"info"}]}'

examples.name: Resume Auto-Transitions
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"resume-transitions","actions":[{"type":"transition.resume"},{"type":"notify","title":"Transitions Resumed","message":"Auto-transitions resumed","severity":"success"}]}'

examples.name: Critical Alert with Navigation
examples.description: Show critical alert and navigate to system monitor
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"critical-alert","actions":[{"type":"notify","title":"Critical Alert","message":"System temperature critically high!","severity":"error","duration":10000},{"type":"transition.pause"}]}'

examples.name: Update Config (In-Memory)
examples.description: Update a configuration value in memory only
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"config-update","actions":[{"type":"config.update","path":"autoTransitionEnabled","value":false},{"type":"notify","title":"Config Updated","message":"Auto-transitions disabled","severity":"info"}]}'

examples.name: Refresh Dashboard
examples.curl: curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/events/trigger -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"refresh-dashboard","actions":[{"type":"refresh","target":"all"},{"type":"notify","title":"Refreshing","message":"Dashboard refresh triggered","severity":"info"}]}'

steps: 1. Start the server: npm run api
2. Start the dashboard: npm run start:network
3. Open another terminal and run any curl command from the examples above
4. Watch the dashboard respond in real-time!
notes: - The WebSocket server runs on port 3001 at path /ws
- Events are broadcast to all connected clients
- Config updates are in-memory only by default (not saved to disk)
